thread.title: Year-On-Year Fall in U.S. Oil Output Is Imminent
thread.title_full: Year-On-Year Fall in U.S. Oil Output Is Imminent - WSJ

author: Eric Yep
title: Year-On-Year Fall in U.S. Oil Output Is Imminent
text: 0324 GMT [Dow Jones] The next key milestones in the decline of U.S. crude oil output are imminent--when U.S. crude output falls below 9 million barrels/day and when year-on-year declines commence, Paul Horsnell, head of commodities research at Standard Chartered Bank, says. “Our forecast is that both events will happen in October,” he says. U.S. oil production has already started to fall sequentially following April’s peak of 9.61 million barrels a day. Additionally, lower price expectations and deteriorating credit conditions are likely to keep U.S. oil drilling activity low, he says. Nymex oil futures are flat at...
